answer_validation.reasoning: The nth derivative of the function y = 1 / (x + 3) can be derived using the power rule of differentiation. The general formula for the nth derivative of a function f(x) = 1 / (x + a) is ((-1)^n * n!) / (x + a)^(n+1). In this case, a = 3, so the nth derivative is ((-1)^n * n!) / (x + 3)^(n+1), which matches option A.

step_by_step: Apply the power rule of differentiation to find the nth derivative:
The power rule states that the nth derivative of f(x) = x^n is f^(n)(x) = n! * x^(n-1)
In this case, f(x) = 1 / (x + 3), so f'(x) = -1 / (x + 3)^2
Applying the power rule, the nth derivative is f^(n)(x) = ((-1)^n * n!) / (x + 3)^(n+1)
